column4: Hope someone can help me,  i've installed ubuntu on a ext hd   while pluged to my main pc  "which has a nvidia card"    but I really use this on my laptop which has a Intel Mobile 4 series graphics card.   I dont have any 3d acceleration and can't use  Unity or gnome shell because of it   can anyone help ?
you'd want to reconfigure X for intel
k,  have no clue  how
probably xserver-xorg-video-intel
i was lost    will this site help me out if i follow it ?   http://superuser.com/questions/192121/how-to-install-intel-82852-855gm-driver-on-ubuntu-10-10-maverick-meerkat
I doubt you'll need to go to such lengths
first I'd try simply mv'ing /etc/X11/xorg.conf elsewhere (you might want it later for the nvidia box), and making sure xserver-xorg-video-intel is installed
k  how to i make sure of that ?
try it and if it works you know and if it doesn't work you know
my xorg.conf  just says default device    it doesn't even say  nvidia
not necessarily relevant :p
point is nvidia's driver (not nouveau) uses xorg.conf, but using intel you shouldn't need it (and probably further do not want it present)
ok i've moved it     now what,,   reboot,  and what do i do if it doesn't boot back ?
it'll boot whether X works or not
did you make sure the package was installed?
sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-intel
ok newest version is installed
if X doesn't start use CTRL+ALT+F2 if necessary to drop to a console, you can use the package 'irssi' to IRC from outside of X, good luck
ok  still  I dont have the ability to use gnome shell     or Unity     keep getting reverted to  gnome classic
that's not necessarily abnormal, I believe it assesses your hardware and chooses which based on what you've got
its like I have no drivers installed at all   even google earth says  unknown graphics card and closes
ok   Unity works now  not well but works,   gnomeshell and google earth does not,  I still dont know whats going on ?
I doubt googleearth is related
gnome shell I don't know, it might require accel
